description: Hands-on experience with spectroscopic and computational techniques. Reports include short answer questions, data presentation, analysis, and discussion. Requires attendance at 7/8 laboratory classes.
2hr 10min examination covering all course topics (MCQ, short numerical, and short answer responses). Must achieve 35% combined with mid-term exam to pass course.
Quizzes and worksheets applying lecture content to solve problems. Four assignments worth 5% each, typically due in weeks 3, 5, 8 and 10.
45-minute test covering weeks 1-4 lecture material (multiple-choice and short answer questions). Combined with final exam for hurdle requirement.
